result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary Lee Madlock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay a fine of $100 PLUS all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge by 12-07-2015. Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to the monies owed. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

TIME SERVED
Consecutive to: to any sentence with credit for 10 days.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary Lee Madlock

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gary Lee Madlock in court with Attorney Bernard S. Stein.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

Court sentenced defendant to serve  10 DAYS  in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 10 days; TIME SERVED.  

Court ordered defendant to pay a FINE of $100  PLUS all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge by 12-07-2015.  Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to the monies owed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  If there is any remaining bail posted; to be returned to the remittur.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Gary Lee Madlock in court with attorney Bernard S. Stein.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  As to the charged offense:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Case adjourned to 10-7-2015 for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Gary Lee Madlock in court with attorney Bernard S. Stein.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 9-16-2015 at 8:15 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld

Defendant Gary Lee Madlock in court with attorney Bernard S. Stein.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  There is a remaining 911 cd that will need to be forwarded to defense counsel, per the State.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-10-2015 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Kimberly C., no firearms in possession and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld

15RM022814  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/01/2015
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KIMBERLY C.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Gary Lee Madlock in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Gary Lee Madlock in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
